speaker.whotheyare: Angela Mahecha Adrar helps shape national and international agendas on climate change strategies.
speaker.whylisten: Angela Mahecha Adrar is the director of the Environmental Justice Movement Fellowship at the New School, a two-year leadership program developed with and for environmental justice grassroots leaders. The fellowship comes at a critical time when grassroots organizing has influenced elections, shifted congressional power and made strides in developing policy from the local to federal levels. She has committed her life to advancing the grassroots sector and providing leadership and structure to serve changing and complex priorities of local communities like those of the Climate Justice Alliance. She has served on multiple boards, advisory committees and leadership teams to move multimillion dollar investments to the grassroots sector.
